1.heading: Goodness.
1.title: "Father"
1.author: story, Todd McFarlane ; art, Todd McFarlane, Greg Capullo ; special thanks to Kevin Conrad ; copy editor & letters, Tom Orzechowski ; color, Steve Oliff and Olyoptics
notes: "This story begins where we left Spawn at the close of the Angela miniseries, issue 3."

SUMMARY: Spawn confronts child abuse when he is befriended by a small boy. The father is a respected church member and a policeman. Spawn tattoos the phrase "I beat my kids" all over the man's body, and tells him it will fade in a month if he is good, and Spawn leaves. The beatings start again and an older brother takes the father's gun and shoots him (summary by Mary Walker).

4.heading: Goodness.
4.title: "Muffo the Magician"
4.author: [No author]
4.series: Atom the Cat) 8 p. in Atom the Cat, no. 13
notes: SUMMARY: Muffo uses his magic for mean tricks rather than for good, and tries to defeat Atom the Cat by making all the fish in the world disappear so that Atom won't have his super powers. k. Magicians. k. Mean tricks. k. Goodness. k. Fish. Call no.: PN6728.2.C47B6no.13

5.title: Goodness. "Spirit in the Stone" 5 p. in Chamber of Chills Magazine, no. 5

notes: "After the thing fell from the skies, one man dreamed of good, the other of evil, but neither man had reckoned with the consequences of tinkering with that horrible life force."

58.author: Archie Goodwin, writer ; Walt Simonson, art
58.appears_in: 8 p. in Detective Comics, no. 437 (Nov. 1973) ; reprinted in Dynamic Classics, no. 1 (Sept./Oct. 1978)
notes: "Chapter 1"

SUMMARY: Dharmata has retreated to a remote monastery in Nepal, after almost rousing a neighboring nation (Tibet?) to revolution; Paul Kirk, the Manhunter, finds him and protects him from a group of assassins, all of whom are doubles of Kirk. I. Goodwin, Archie. II. Simonson, Walt. III. Manhunter. k. Dharmata. k. Nepal. k. Tibet. k. Monasteries. k. Revolution. k. Assassins. k. Incidents. k. Doubles. k. Kirk, Paul.
